ticket.title: no such file to load test_helper
ticket.original-body:
When running unit test individually via @@@ $ ruby test/unit/city_test.rb @@@
I get:
@@@ test/unit/city_test.rb:1:in `require': no such file to load -- test_helper (LoadError) from test/unit/city_test.rb:1:in `<main>' @@@
@@@ $ ruby -v ruby 1.9.2dev (2010-07-02 revision 28524) [x86_64-darwin10.4.0] $ rails -v Rails 3.0.0.beta4 @@@
in city_test.rb I have:
@@@ require "test_helper"
class CityTest < ActiveSupport::TestCase test "the truth" do assert false end end @@@
i've tried variations of using require "../test_helper", adding the .rb extension and adding File.dirname(__FILE__) to the front of the require and same results.

ticket.original-body-html:
When running unit test individually via

$ ruby test/unit/city_test.rb

I get:

test/unit/city_test.rb:1:in `require': no such file to load -- test_helper (LoadError)
    from test/unit/city_test.rb:1:in `<main>'

$ ruby -v
ruby 1.9.2dev (2010-07-02 revision 28524) [x86_64-darwin10.4.0]
$ rails -v
Rails 3.0.0.beta4

in city_test.rb I have:

require "test_helper"

class CityTest < ActiveSupport::TestCase
  test "the truth" do
    assert false
  end
end

i've tried variations of using require "../test_helper", adding the .rb extension and adding File.dirname(FILE) to the front of the require and same results.

version.title: no such file to load test_helper

version.body: Try @ruby -Itest test/unit/city_test.rb@. The top line should be @require "test_helper"@. The @-Itest@ adds the test directory to the load path.
version.body-html: Try ruby -Itest test/unit/city_test.rb. The top line should be require "test_helper". The -Itest adds the test directory to the load path.

version.body: If Henrik's advice doesn't work, make a comment and I'll reopen.
version.body-html: If Henrik's advice doesn't work, make a comment and I'll reopen.

version.title: no such file to load test_helper

version.body:
Why is this invalid? This fails for me too:
cd test ruby unit/user_test.rb <internal:lib/rubygems/custom_require>:29:in `require': no such file to load -- test_helper (LoadError)
According to http://guides.rubyonrails.org/testing.html#running-tests this should work, but I have to add `-I.` to make that work. What changed?
version.body-html:
Why is this invalid? This fails for me too:

cd test
ruby unit/user_test.rb 
<internal:lib/rubygems/custom_require>:29:in `require': no such file to load -- test_helper (LoadError)

According to http://guides.rubyonrails.org/testing.html#running-tests this should work, but I have to add -I. to make that work. What changed?
version.title: no such file to load test_helper

version.body:
It won't work without the -I because test is not in the load path. To add it to the load path you need to use -Itest. The error is quite self explanatory, it can't find the file test_helper — it's because test is not in the load path.
However I think now the docs need fixing. I'll see what I can do. Thanks David.
version.body-html:
It won't work without the -I because test is not in the load path. To add it to the load path you need to use -Itest. The error is quite self explanatory, it can't find the file test_helper — it's because test is not in the load path.

However I think now the docs need fixing. I'll see what I can do. Thanks David.
version.title: no such file to load test_helper

version.body: This supra footwear is called a modern vintage and has been since their introduction in 2003 where they began in Europe. Every supra shoes has some type of ornament, adornment or hardware and is comprised of aged leather that is bought from around the world. These supra uk are culturally engaging and allow for the woman wearing them to be enveloped in luxury.With new cuts and styles and hand stitched shoes, these timberland boots, heels or flats will make every foot look like it stepped out of vintage Hollywood. This timberland shoes have been worn and coveted by many of the most famous females in recent history. One such coach outlet, Jennifer Aniston, wears them in public and at home.This company makes many different unique styles of bags outlet from ankle booties to sandals, pumps, moncler jackets online, platforms and wedges. One louis vuitton bag in particular is ideal for the gothic style sense; it is patent leather and laces up the front of the shaft. There are also zippers on each side, and this shoe offers a flat heel of a half inch.Another great moncler jackets sale is featured in People's Style Watch and is called a platform bootie. This ture religion jeans has a raised panel in front of the ankle as well as a heel that measures 4.5 inches. The front offers a leather bandage appearance and is considered high fashion.
